intro: Haumaniastrum robertii, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as thick leaves and deep root systems. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for xeriscaping in drought-prone regions.
